moves.1. c4: Another game from the Halibut tournament, I made a lot of mistakes, mostly early on but luckily managed to claw my way back all thanks to one pawn.
moves.4. Bb2 d6: I really didn't like this move but could see no alternative
moves.5. e4: weakens whites d pawn but can I take advantage
moves.5... Nf6 6. Bd3: Whites pawn is going nowhere a the moment so having a bishop in its way isn't really a problem at the moment
moves.6... O-O 7. Nf3 Bg4: I think at this point white is feeling a little constrained, that was certainly my intention.
moves.8. h3 Bh5: Hoping for, but not expecting, g4
moves.9. Bc3 Bc5: I dont want to exchange as I am happy with my dsb.
moves.10. b4 Bb6 11. a4 c5 12. a5 cxb4: This is a miscalculation on my part
moves.13. axb6 a5: This seems to make things worse for black however this pawn helps win the game.
moves.14. Bxb4 Qxb6: With a material deficit against a much stronger player it was obvious I needed to start improving my play but what to do.
moves.15. O-O Nbd7 16. Ba3 Nc5: As white has the shop pair I decided to pressure his bishops
moves.17. Bxc5 Qxc5 18. Nc3: At this point I was thinking I wouldn't last much longer especially with whites passed pawn closer to the end of the board.
moves.18... Nd7 19. Nd5 Kh8 20. Ne3 Nb6: Not only does this prevent the white pawns progress, it also strengthens the path forward for my a pawn
moves.21. g4: At first I thought this was a mistake but I can't see any way for me to take advantage of it
moves.23. Bxe4 d5 24. Bd3 e4: I figured that white was trying to preserve his passed b pawn, this gave me a chance to regain some material
moves.25. Be2: Possibly whites first mistake, this gave me the glimmer of hope
moves.25... d4: If the knight moves away I have whites lsb trapped by pawns wth d3
moves.26. Rc1 Qg5 27. Nef5: About the only way to keep the knights.
moves.27... d3: but now its the bishops turn to fall
moves.28. Bf3: This was a little unexpected, I was expecting Bxd3
moves.28... exf3 29. Nxf3 Qd8 30. Re1 a4: Time to start pushing that pawn for promotion.
moves.31. Ne5 Qd5 32. Qf3 a3: In theory I probably shouldn't exchange queens but this gave me an opportunity to push the pawn a little more
moves.36... Na4: but I have plans of my own
moves.37. Qa3: I think this is a mistake as white voluntarily leaves the queen open to a revealed attack
moves.37... Nb2: Now I have the threat of forking the rooks which will bring the pawn another step nearer to promotion
moves.38. Qg3 Nd3: And there we have it. Does white have the resources to prevent me getting 2 queens.
moves.41. Ng6+ Kg8: I chose this simply so that I could retake with the king if he takes the rook as that would leave my a pawn defended.
moves.42. Ne7+ Kh7 43. h4 Nxc1: And now promotion is getting ever nearer but first I have a nice little plan if only I can pull it off
moves.44. hxg5 Ne2+ 45. Rxe2 a1=Q+: And there it is, two queens against a much stronger opponent, surely I had to have a chance now.
moves.46. Kh2 Qxg5 47. Qd3+ Kh8 48. Ng6+ Kg8 4: Here I thought he may have been looking for a draw by repitition
moves.50... Kh7 51. Nxf8+ Kg8 52. Ng6: This is a mistake but I am not sure what was better
moves.52... Qh6+: White resigned, thanks for reading please comment.
